name: equinix-metal
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing equinix-metal cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`metal` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/equinix/terraform-provider-metal).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing equinix-metal cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/equinix/terraform-provider-metal)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-equinix-metal` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-equinix-metal/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-metal` repo](https://github.com/equinix/terraform-provider-metal/issues).

> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,

authToken.description: The API auth key for API operations.

speed.description: Port speed in bits per second

cidr.description: CIDR suffix for IP address block to be assigned, i.e. amount of addresses.

reservationIds.description:
List of UUIDs of IP block reservations from which the public IPv4 address should be taken.

You can supply one `ip_address` block per IP address type. If you use the `ip_address` you must always pass a block for `private_ipv4`.

To learn more about using the reserved IP addresses for new devices, see the examples in the equinix-metal.ReservedIpBlock documentation.

The `reinstall` block has 3 fields:

cidr.description: CIDR suffix for IP address block to be assigned, i.e. amount of addresses.

public.description: whether the address is routable from the Internet

bonded.description: Whether this port is part of a bond in bonded network setup

id.description: ID of the port

mac.description: MAC address assigned to the port

deprovisionFast.description: Whether the OS disk should be filled with `00h` bytes before reinstall. Defaults to `false`.

enabled.description: Whether the provider should favour reinstall over destroy and create. Defaults to `false`.

preserveData.description: Whether the non-OS disks should be kept or wiped during reinstall. Defaults to `false`.

asn.description: Autonomous System Number for local BGP deployment

deploymentType.description: `private` or `public`, the `private` is likely to be usable immediately, the `public` will need to be review by Equinix Metal engineers

maxPrefix.description: The maximum number of route filters allowed per server

md5.description: Password for BGP session in plaintext (not a checksum)

status.description: status of BGP configuration in the project

id.description: Port UUID

speed.description: Port speed in bits per second

virtualCircuitIds.description: List of IDs of virtual cicruits attached to this port

md5Enabled.description: Whether BGP session is password enabled

md5Password.description: BGP session password in plaintext (not a checksum)

multihop.description: Whether the neighbor is in EBGP multihop session

peerAs.description: Peer AS number (different than customer_as for EBGP)

peerIps.description: Array of IP addresses of this neighbor's peers

routesIns.description: Array of incoming routes. Each route has attributes:

routesOuts.description: Array of outgoing routes in the same format

cidr.description: Bit length of the network mask of the address

public.description: Whether the address is routable from the Internet

bonded.description: Whether this port is part of a bond in bonded network setup

id.description: ID of the port

mac.description: MAC address assigned to the port

asn.description: Autonomous System Number for local BGP deployment

deploymentType.description: `private` or `public`, the `private` is likely to be usable immediately, the `public` will need to be review by Equinix Metal engineers

maxPrefix.description: The maximum number of route filters allowed per server

md5.description: Password for BGP session in plaintext (not a checksum)

status.description: status of BGP configuration in the project

provider.description:
The provider type for the metal package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

authToken.description: The API auth key for API operations.
The API auth key for API operations.

equinix-metal:index/bgpSession:BgpSessio.description:
Provides a resource to manage BGP sessions in Equinix Metal Host. Refer to [Equinix Metal BGP documentation](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/networking/local-global-bgp/) for more details.

You need to have BGP config enabled in your project.

BGP session must be linked to a device running [BIRD](https://bird.network.cz) or other BGP routing daemon which will control route advertisements via the session to Equinix Metal's upstream routers.

defaultRoute.description: Boolean flag to set the default route policy. False by default.
Boolean flag to set the default route policy. False by default.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering BgpSession resources.

defaultRoute.description: Boolean flag to set the default route policy. False by default.

facility.description: Facility where the connection will be created

metro.description: Metro where the connection will be created

mode.description: Mode for connections in IBX facilities with the dedicated type - standard or tunnel

organizationId.description: ID of the organization responsible for the connection

ports.description: List of connection ports - primary (`ports[0]`) and secondary (`ports[1]`). Schema of port is described in documentation of the equinix-metal.Connection datasource.

projectId.description: ID of the project where the connection is scoped to, must be set for shared connection

speed.description: Port speed in bits per second

facility.description: Facility where the connection will be created

metro.description: Metro where the connection will be created

mode.description: Mode for connections in IBX facilities with the dedicated type - standard or tunnel

organizationId.description: ID of the organization responsible for the connection

projectId.description: ID of the project where the connection is scoped to, must be set for shared connection

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Connection resources.

facility.description: Facility where the connection will be created

metro.description: Metro where the connection will be created

mode.description: Mode for connections in IBX facilities with the dedicated type - standard or tunnel

organizationId.description: ID of the organization responsible for the connection

ports.description: List of connection ports - primary (`ports[0]`) and secondary (`ports[1]`). Schema of port is described in documentation of the equinix-metal.Connection datasource.

projectId.description: ID of the project where the connection is scoped to, must be set for shared connection

speed.description: Port speed in bits per second

accessPrivateIpv4.description: The ipv4 private IP assigned to the device

accessPublicIpv4.description: The ipv4 maintenance IP assigned to the device

accessPublicIpv6.description: The ipv6 maintenance IP assigned to the device

alwaysPxe.description: If true, a device with OS `custom_ipxe` will continue to boot via iPXE on reboots.

created.description: The timestamp for when the device was created

customData.description: A string of the desired Custom Data for the device.

deployedFacility.description: The facility where the device is deployed.

deployedHardwareReservationId.description: ID of hardware reservation where this device was deployed. It is useful when using the `next-available` hardware reservation.

facilities.description: List of facility codes with deployment preferences. Equinix Metal API will go through the list and will deploy your device to first facility with free capacity. List items must be facility codes or `any` (a wildcard). To find the facility code, visit [Facilities API docs](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/api/facilities/), set your API auth token in the top of the page and see JSON from the API response. Conflicts with `metro`.

forceDetachVolumes.description: Delete device even if it has volumes attached. Only applies for destroy action.

hardwareReservationId.description:
The UUID of the hardware reservation where you want this device deployed, or next-available if you want to pick your
next available reservation automatically

hostname.description: The device hostname used in deployments taking advantage of Layer3 DHCP or metadata service configuration.

ipAddresses.description: A list of IP address types for the device (structure is documented below).

ipxeScriptUrl.description: URL pointing to a hosted iPXE script. More information is in the [Custom iPXE](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/servers/custom-ipxe/) doc.

metro.description: Metro area for the new device. Conflicts with `facilities`.

networkType.description: Network type of a device, used in [Layer 2 networking](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/networking/layer2/). Will be one of `layer3`, `hybrid`, `layer2-individual` and `layer2-bonded`.
networkType.deprecationMessage: You should handle Network Type with the new metal_device_network_type resource.

networks.description:
The device's private and public IP (v4 and v6) network details. When a device is run without any special network configuration, it will have 3 networks:
* Public IPv4 at `metal_device.name.network.0`
* IPv6 at `metal_device.name.network.1`
* Private IPv4 at `metal_device.name.network.2`
Elastic addresses then stack by type - an assigned public IPv4 will go after the management public IPv4 (to index 1), and will then shift the indices of the IPv6 and private IPv4. Assigned private IPv4 will go after the management private IPv4 (to the end of the network list).
The fields of the network attributes are:

operatingSystem.description: The operating system slug. To find the slug, or visit [Operating Systems API docs](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/api/operatingsystems), set your API auth token in the top of the page and see JSON from the API response.

plan.description: The device plan slug. To find the plan slug, visit [Device plans API docs](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/api/plans), set your auth token in the top of the page and see JSON from the API response.

projectId.description: The ID of the project in which to create the device

projectSshKeyIds.description: Array of IDs of the project SSH keys which should be added to the device. If you omit this, SSH keys of all the members of the parent project will be added to the device. If you specify this array, only the listed project SSH keys will be added. Project SSH keys can be created with the equinix-metal.ProjectSshKey resource.

reinstall.description: Whether the device should be reinstalled instead of destroyed when modifying user_data, custom_data, or operating system.

rootPassword.description: Root password to the server (disabled after 24 hours)

sshKeyIds.description: List of IDs of SSH keys deployed in the device, can be both user and project SSH keys

storage.description: JSON for custom partitioning. Only usable on reserved hardware. More information in in the [Custom Partitioning and RAID](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/servers/custom-partitioning-raid/) doc. Please note that the disks.partitions.size attribute must be a string, not an integer. It can be a number string, or size notation string, e.g. "4G" or "8M" (for gigabytes and megabytes).

terminationTime.description: Timestamp for device termination. For example `2021-09-03T16:32:00+03:00`. If you don't supply timezone info, timestamp is assumed to be in UTC.

updated.description: The timestamp for the last time the device was updated

userData.description: A string of the desired User Data for the device.

waitForReservationDeprovision.description:
Only used for devices in reserved hardware. If set, the deletion of this device will block until the hardware reservation is marked provisionable (about 4 minutes in August 2019).

The `ip_address` block has 3 fields:

Conflicts with `metro`.

waitForReservationDeprovision.description:
Only used for devices in reserved hardware. If set, the deletion of this device will block until the hardware reservation is marked provisionable (about 4 minutes in August 2019).

The `ip_address` block has 3 fields:

deviceId.description: The ID of the device on which the network type should be set.

type.description: Network type to set. Must be one of `layer3`, `hybrid`, `layer2-individual` and `layer2-bonded`.

deviceId.description: The ID of the device on which the network type should be set.

type.description: Network type to set. Must be one of `layer3`, `hybrid`, `layer2-individual` and `layer2-bonded`.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering DeviceNetworkType resources.

deviceId.description: The ID of the device on which the network type should be set.

type.description: Network type to set. Must be one of `layer3`, `hybrid`, `layer2-individual` and `layer2-bonded`.

ipReservationId.description: UUID of IP reservation block to bind to the gateway, the reservation must be in the same metro as the VLAN, conflicts with `private_ipv4_subnet_size`

privateIpv4SubnetSize.description: Size of the private IPv4 subnet to create for this metal gateway, must be one of (8, 16, 32, 64, 128), conflicts with `ip_reservation_id`

projectId.description: UUID of the project where the gateway is scoped to

vlanId.description: UUID of the VLAN where the gateway is scoped to

vlanId.description: UUID of the VLAN where the gateway is scoped to

vlanId.description: UUID of the VLAN where the gateway is scoped to

equinix-metal:index/ipAttachment:IpAttac.description:
Provides a resource to attach elastic IP subnets to devices.

To attach an IP subnet from a reserved block to a provisioned device, you must derive a subnet CIDR belonging to
one of your reserved blocks in the same project and facility as the target device.

For example, you have reserved IPv4 address block 147.229.10.152/30, you can choose to assign either the whole
block as one subnet to a device; or 2 subnets with CIDRs 147.229.10.152/31' and 147.229.10.154/31; or 4 subnets
with mask prefix length 32. More about the elastic IP subnets is [here](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/networking/elastic-ips/).

Device and reserved block must be in the same facility.

cidr.description: length of CIDR prefix of the subnet as integer

cidrNotation.description:
CIDR notation of subnet from block reserved in the same
project and facility as the device

deviceId.description: ID of device to which to assign the subnet

gateway.description: IP address of gateway for the subnet

global.description: Flag indicating whether IP block is global, i.e. assignable in any location

netmask.description: Subnet mask in decimal notation, e.g. "255.255.255.0"

public.description: boolean flag whether subnet is reachable from the Internet

cidrNotation.description:
CIDR notation of subnet from block reserved in the same
project and facility as the device

deviceId.description: ID of device to which to assign the subnet

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering IpAttachment resources.

cidr.description: length of CIDR prefix of the subnet as integer

cidrNotation.description:
CIDR notation of subnet from block reserved in the same
project and facility as the device

deviceId.description: ID of device to which to assign the subnet

gateway.description: IP address of gateway for the subnet

global.description: Flag indicating whether IP block is global, i.e. assignable in any location

netmask.description: Subnet mask in decimal notation, e.g. "255.255.255.0"

public.description: boolean flag whether subnet is reachable from the Internet

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Organization resources.

bonded.description: Whether the port should be bonded

disbondSupported.description: Flag indicating whether the port can be removed from a bond

layer2.description: Whether to put the port to Layer 2 mode, valid only for bond ports

name.description: Name of the port, e.g. `bond0` or `eth0`

nativeVlanId.description: UUID of a VLAN to assign as a native VLAN. It must be one of attached VLANs (from `vlan_ids` parameter), valid only for physical (non-bond) ports

networkType.description: One of layer2-bonded, layer2-individual, layer3, hybrid and hybrid-bonded. This attribute is only set on bond ports.

portId.description: ID of the port to read

resetOnDelete.description: Behavioral setting to reset the port to default settings. For a bond port it means layer3 without vlans attached, eth ports will be bonded without native vlan and vlans attached

type.description: Type is either "NetworkBondPort" for bond ports or "NetworkPort" for bondable ethernet ports

vlanIds.description: List of VLAN UUIDs to attach to the port, valid only for L2 and Hybrid ports

vxlanIds.description: List of VXLAN IDs to attach to the port, valid only for L2 and Hybrid ports

bonded.description: Whether the port should be bonded

layer2.description: Whether to put the port to Layer 2 mode, valid only for bond ports

nativeVlanId.description: UUID of a VLAN to assign as a native VLAN. It must be one of attached VLANs (from `vlan_ids` parameter), valid only for physical (non-bond) ports

portId.description: ID of the port to read

resetOnDelete.description: Behavioral setting to reset the port to default settings. For a bond port it means layer3 without vlans attached, eth ports will be bonded without native vlan and vlans attached

vlanIds.description: List of VLAN UUIDs to attach to the port, valid only for L2 and Hybrid ports

vxlanIds.description: List of VXLAN IDs to attach to the port, valid only for L2 and Hybrid ports

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Port resources.

bonded.description: Whether the port should be bonded

disbondSupported.description: Flag indicating whether the port can be removed from a bond

layer2.description: Whether to put the port to Layer 2 mode, valid only for bond ports

name.description: Name of the port, e.g. `bond0` or `eth0`

nativeVlanId.description: UUID of a VLAN to assign as a native VLAN. It must be one of attached VLANs (from `vlan_ids` parameter), valid only for physical (non-bond) ports

networkType.description: One of layer2-bonded, layer2-individual, layer3, hybrid and hybrid-bonded. This attribute is only set on bond ports.

portId.description: ID of the port to read

resetOnDelete.description: Behavioral setting to reset the port to default settings. For a bond port it means layer3 without vlans attached, eth ports will be bonded without native vlan and vlans attached

type.description: Type is either "NetworkBondPort" for bond ports or "NetworkPort" for bondable ethernet ports

vlanIds.description: List of VLAN UUIDs to attach to the port, valid only for L2 and Hybrid ports

vxlanIds.description: List of VXLAN IDs to attach to the port, valid only for L2 and Hybrid ports

deviceId.description: ID of device to be assigned to the VLAN

forceBond.description: Add port back to the bond when this resource is removed. Default is false.

native.description: Mark this VLAN a native VLAN on the port. This can be used only if this assignment assigns second or further VLAN to the port. To ensure that this attachment is not first on a port, you can use `depends_on` pointing to another metal_port_vlan_attachment, just like in the layer2-individual example above.

portName.description: Name of network port to be assigned to the VLAN

deviceId.description: ID of device to be assigned to the VLAN

forceBond.description: Add port back to the bond when this resource is removed. Default is false.

native.description: Mark this VLAN a native VLAN on the port. This can be used only if this assignment assigns second or further VLAN to the port. To ensure that this attachment is not first on a port, you can use `depends_on` pointing to another metal_port_vlan_attachment, just like in the layer2-individual example above.

portName.description: Name of network port to be assigned to the VLAN

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering PortVlanAttachment resources.

deviceId.description: ID of device to be assigned to the VLAN

forceBond.description: Add port back to the bond when this resource is removed. Default is false.

native.description: Mark this VLAN a native VLAN on the port. This can be used only if this assignment assigns second or further VLAN to the port. To ensure that this attachment is not first on a port, you can use `depends_on` pointing to another metal_port_vlan_attachment, just like in the layer2-individual example above.

portName.description: Name of network port to be assigned to the VLAN

backendTransfer.description: Enable or disable [Backend Transfer](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/networking/backend-transfer/), default is false

bgpConfig.description:
Optional BGP settings. Refer to [Equinix Metal guide for BGP](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/networking/local-global-bgp/).

Once you set the BGP config in a project, it can't be removed (due to a limitation in the Equinix Metal API). It can be updated.

created.description: The timestamp for when the project was created

organizationId.description: The UUID of organization under which you want to create the project. If you leave it out, the project will be create under your the default organization of your account.

paymentMethodId.description: The UUID of payment method for this project. The payment method and the project need to belong to the same organization (passed with `organization_id`, or default).

updated.description: The timestamp for the last time the project was updated

backendTransfer.description: Enable or disable [Backend Transfer](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/networking/backend-transfer/), default is false

bgpConfig.description:
Optional BGP settings. Refer to [Equinix Metal guide for BGP](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/networking/local-global-bgp/).

Once you set the BGP config in a project, it can't be removed (due to a limitation in the Equinix Metal API). It can be updated.

organizationId.description: The UUID of organization under which you want to create the project. If you leave it out, the project will be create under your the default organization of your account.

paymentMethodId.description: The UUID of payment method for this project. The payment method and the project need to belong to the same organization (passed with `organization_id`, or default).

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Project resources.

backendTransfer.description: Enable or disable [Backend Transfer](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/networking/backend-transfer/), default is false

bgpConfig.description:
Optional BGP settings. Refer to [Equinix Metal guide for BGP](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/networking/local-global-bgp/).

Once you set the BGP config in a project, it can't be removed (due to a limitation in the Equinix Metal API). It can be updated.

created.description: The timestamp for when the project was created

organizationId.description: The UUID of organization under which you want to create the project. If you leave it out, the project will be create under your the default organization of your account.

paymentMethodId.description: The UUID of payment method for this project. The payment method and the project need to belong to the same organization (passed with `organization_id`, or default).

updated.description: The timestamp for the last time the project was updated

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getConnection.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getConnection.

facility.description: Slug of a facility to which the connection belongs

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

metro.description: Slug of a metro to which the connection belongs

mode.description: Mode for connections in IBX facilities with the dedicated type - standard or tunnel

organizationId.description: ID of organization to which the connection belongs

ports.description: List of connection ports - primary (`ports[0]`) and secondary (`ports[1]`)

projectId.description: ID of project to which the connection belongs

speed.description: Port speed in bits per second

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getDevice.

deviceId.description:
Device ID

User can lookup devices either by `device_id` or `project_id` and `hostname`.

projectId.description: The id of the project in which the devices exists

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getDevice.

accessPrivateIpv4.description: The ipv4 private IP assigned to the device

accessPublicIpv4.description: The ipv4 management IP assigned to the device

accessPublicIpv6.description: The ipv6 management IP assigned to the device

billingCycle.description: The billing cycle of the device (monthly or hourly)

facility.description: The facility where the device is deployed.

hardwareReservationId.description: The id of hardware reservation which this device occupies

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

metro.description: The metro where the device is deployed

networkType.description: L2 network type of the device, one of "layer3", "layer2-bonded", "layer2-individual", "hybrid"

networks.description:
The device's private and public IP (v4 and v6) network details. When a device is run without any special network configuration, it will have 3 networks:
* Public IPv4 at `metal_device.name.network.0`
* IPv6 at `metal_device.name.network.1`
* Private IPv4 at `metal_device.name.network.2`
Elastic addresses then stack by type - an assigned public IPv4 will go after the management public IPv4 (to index 1), and will then shift the indices of the IPv6 and private IPv4. Assigned private IPv4 will go after the management private IPv4 (to the end of the network list).
The fields of the network attributes are:

operatingSystem.description: The operating system running on the device

plan.description: The hardware config of the device

rootPassword.description: Root password to the server (if still available)

sshKeyIds.description: List of IDs of SSH keys deployed in the device, can be both user or project SSH keys

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getDeviceBgpNeighbors.

deviceId.description: UUID of BGP-enabled device whose neighbors to list

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getDeviceBgpNeighbors.

bgpNeighbors.description: array of BGP neighbor records with attributes:

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

equinix-metal:index/getFacility:getFacil.description: Provides an Equinix Metal facility datasource.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getFacility.

capacities.description: (Optional) Ensure that queried facility has capacity for specified number of given plans

featuresRequireds.description:
Set of feature strings that the facility must have

Facilities can be looked up by `code`.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getFacility.

capacities.description: (Optional) Ensure that queried facility has capacity for specified number of given plans

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

metro.description: The metro code the facility is part of

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getGateway.

gatewayId.description: UUID of the metal gateway resource to retrieve

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getGateway.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

ipReservationId.description: UUID of IP reservation block bound to the gateway

privateIpv4SubnetSize.description: Size of the private IPv4 subnet bound to this metal gateway, one of (8, 16, 32, 64, 128)`

projectId.description: UUID of the project where the gateway is scoped to

vlanId.description: UUID of the VLAN where the gateway is scoped to

equinix-metal:index/getHardwareReservati.description:
Use this data source to retrieve a [hardware reservation resource from Equinix Metal](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/deploy/reserved/).

You can look up hardware reservation by its ID or by ID of device which occupies it.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getHardwareReservation.

deviceId.description: UUID of device occupying the reservation

id.description: ID of the hardware reservation

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getHardwareReservation.

deviceId.description: UUID of device occupying the reservation

id.description: ID of the hardware reservation to look up

projectId.description: UUID of project this reservation is scoped to

provisionable.description: Flag indicating whether the reserved server is provisionable or not. Spare devices can't be provisioned unless they are activated first

spare.description: Flag indicating whether the Hardware Reservation is a spare. Spare Hardware Reservations are used when a Hardware Reservations requires service from Metal Equinix

switchUuid.description: Switch short ID, can be used to determine if two devices are connected to the same switch

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getIpBlockRanges.

facility.description: Facility code filtering the IP blocks. Global IPv4 blcoks will be listed anyway. If you omit this and metro, all the block from the project will be listed.

metro.description: Metro code filtering the IP blocks. Global IPv4 blcoks will be listed anyway. If you omit this and facility, all the block from the project will be listed.

projectId.description: ID of the project from which to list the blocks.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getIpBlockRanges.

globalIpv4s.description: list of CIDR expressions for Global IPv4 blocks in the project

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

ipv6s.description: list of CIDR expressions for IPv6 blocks in the project

privateIpv4s.description: list of CIDR expressions for Private IPv4 blocks in the project

publicIpv4s.description: list of CIDR expressions for Public IPv4 blocks in the project

The metro code

Metros can be looked up by `code`.

capacities.description: (Optional) Ensure that queried metro has capacity for specified number of given plans

id.description: The ID of the metro

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

The UUID of the organization resource

disbondSupported.description: Flag indicating whether the port can be removed from a bond

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

nativeVlanId.description: UUID of native VLAN of the port

networkType.description: One of layer2-bonded, layer2-individual, layer3, hybrid, hybrid-bonded

type.description: Type is either "NetworkBondPort" for bond ports or "NetworkPort" for bondable ethernet ports

equinix-metal:index/getPrecreatedIpBlock.description:
Use this data source to get CIDR expression for precreated IPv6 and IPv4 blocks in Equinix Metal.
You can then use the cidrsubnet TF builtin function to derive subnets.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getPrecreatedIpBlock.

addressFamily.description: 4 or 6, depending on which block you are looking for.

facility.description: Facility of the searched block. (for non-global blocks).

global.description: Whether to look for global block. Default is false for backward compatibility.

metro.description: Metro of the searched block (for non-global blocks).

projectId.description: ID of the project where the searched block should be.

public.description: Whether to look for public or private block.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getPrecreatedIpBlock.

cidrNotation.description: CIDR notation of the looked up block.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

projectId.description: The UUID by which to look up the project

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getProject.

backendTransfer.description: Whether Backend Transfer is enabled for this project

bgpConfigs.description: Optional BGP settings. Refer to [Equinix Metal guide for BGP](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/networking/local-global-bgp/).

created.description: The timestamp for when the project was created

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

organizationId.description: The UUID of this project's parent organization

paymentMethodId.description: The UUID of payment method for this project

updated.description: The timestamp for the last time the project was updated

userIds.description: List of UUIDs of user accounts which belong to this project

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getProjectSshKey.

id.description: The id of the SSH Key to search for in the Equinix Metal project

projectId.description:
The Equinix Metal project id of the Equinix Metal SSH Key

One of either `search` or `id` must be provided along with `project_id`.

search.description:
The name, fingerprint, or public_key of the SSH Key to search for
in the Equinix Metal project

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getProjectSshKey.

fingerprint.description: The fingerprint of the SSH key

id.description: The unique ID of the key

name.description: The name of the SSH key

ownerId.description: The ID of parent project (same as project_id)

projectId.description: The ID of parent project

publicKey.description: The text of the public key

updated.description: The timestamp for the last time the SSH key was updated
